class  Iterator

Detailed Description

Central instance which allows accessing all APOXI devices. The device manager assures a proper initialization of all devices during the startup- and shutdown process. Additionally it is possible during runtime to check the available devices.
See also:
AbstractDevice

Member Function Documentation

void DeviceManager::AddDevice (  AbstractDevice &  device  ) 
 

Adds the device to the device manager. It is recommended that the devices invoke DeviceManager::GetInstance().AddDevice(*this) in their constructor. This allows a static allocation of a device instance. For each added device the method AbstractDevice::OnStart() is invoked when starting up APOXI. This allows the device to initialize itself by having full access to APOXI.

AbstractDevice * DeviceManager::GetDevice (  AbstractDevice::Category  category,
INT  index = 0
)  const
 

Returns a pointer to a device dependent from the category and the index.

Parameters:
category Category of the device (e. g. KeyboardCategory or DisplayCategory).
index Index of the device related to the category. Per default only one device instance of a category is available. But for example the category DisplayCategory might have two instances of a device, where one instance has the index 0 (= main display) and the other instance the index 1 (= sub display).

static Display* DeviceManager::GetDisplay (  INT  display_idx = 0  )  [inline, static]
 

Returns a pointer to the display device. The display device is accessed especially for time critical tasks and hence this wrapper method is offered for a fast access. It's also possible to access the display device in a generic way by DeviceManager::GetInstance().GetDevice(AbstractDevice::DisplayCategory), but DeviceManager::GetDisplay() is faster.

Parameters:
display_idx Index of the display which should be returned. Usually 0 is the main display and 1 the sub display.

DeviceManager & DeviceManager::GetInstance (   )  [static]
 

Returns the DeviceManager instance.

static ClientDc* DeviceManager::GetSharedDc (  INT  display_idx = 0  )  [inline, static]
 

Returns the shared device context for the display with the index display_idx. It should not be necessary for an application to access a shared device context in a direct manner.

void DeviceManager::RemoveDevice (  AbstractDevice &  device  ) 
 

Removes the device from the device manager. It is recommended that the device invokes DeviceManager::GetInstance().RemoveDevice(*this) in their destructor.
